image.altText: A man holding a baby and a crying girl walk past a police officer in a helmet

items.synopsis: A combination of old-fashioned espionage and high-tech surveillance was meant to keep Israelis safe. But when Hamas smashed through the fence, all the systems seemed to fail.

title.children: Paragliders, kidnappings and rockets: How did Hamas pull off such an audacious attack?

image.altText: Fire and smoke rise following an Israeli airstrike, in Gaza City.

items.synopsis: As the death toll from Hamas attacks on Israel and counterstrikes in Gaza climbs, Israel officially declares war and vows to attack Hamas targets.

title.children: Israel formally declares war and says 'significant military steps' to be taken

image.altText: Smiling photo of Selesa Tafaifa

items.synopsis: A Coroner's Court document said body worn and CCTV footage "indicates" Ms Tafaifa died "following a prolonged period of physical restraint", including "the application of handcuffs and the use of a spit hood".

title.children: Selesa Tafaifa died with a spit hood over her head. Lawyers say she pleaded for her puffer six times

image.altText: A close up photo of a man in a blue jacket holding a silver whistle

items.synopsis: Institutions that do the wrong thing usually do what they can to cover it up. That’s the force a whistleblower is up against, writes Adele Ferguson.

title.children: Whistleblowers lose their jobs, marriages and sometimes their freedom. They should be protected, not punished

image.altText: Vilimoni Botitu runs with the ball

items.synopsis: The Wallabies need Portugal to beat Fiji to have any chance of making the Rugby World Cup quarterfinals. Follow all the action in our live blog.

title.children: Fiji and Portugal locked in low-scoring battle as Wallabies watch on

liveBlogPostPrepared.title: Fiji and Portugal locked at 3-3 at half time

liveBlogPostPrepared.plaintext: We've come back for an advantage though and this time Portugal go for the points on offer. We're all square at 3-3!
liveBlogPostPrepared.title: 38' Penalty Portugal

children.content: We've come back for an advantage though and this time Portugal go for the points on offer.

liveBlogPostPrepared.plaintext: Offside at the breakdown against Portugal - an opportunity for the first points of the match to Frank Lomani, who has kicking duties. He's 25 metres out, just to the right of the uprights and he hammers the ball through between the posts. It was an ugly-looking kick but it's still 3-0 Fiji.
liveBlogPostPrepared.title: 9' Fiji penalty

children.content: Offside at the breakdown against Portugal - an opportunity for the first points of the match to Frank Lomani, who has kicking duties.
He's 25 metres out, just to the right of the uprights and he hammers the ball through between the posts.
It was an ugly-looking kick but it's still 3-0 Fiji.

image.altText: A woman answers the phone with one hand while holding a baby who is smiling over her shoulder

items.synopsis: With parents battling year-long childcare waitlists, a new initiative being trialled in North Queensland could be one solution to the childcare crisis.

title.children: Would you bring your baby to the office? For these mums, it's a workable option

items.synopsis: Terrifying eyewitness accounts and videos emerge showing how Hamas's surprise attack on Israel caught soldiers and civilians unaware, including at a dance party in the desert.

title.children: Israelis describe 'nightmare' as Hamas gunmen take hostages at music festival and roam the streets

image.altText: A row boat sinking in the ocean with a man clinging on

items.synopsis: After "holding on for dear life" to his flipped rowboat for 14 hours, Tom from Brisbane was rescued. Hear his recount of the ordeal.

title.children: Naked rower going for world record was saved by a cruise ship, heading home to Queensland

image.altText: Two cricketers embrace.

items.synopsis: Virat Kohli makes the most of being dropped early in his innings to lead India to victory over Australia in their World Cup opener.

title.children: Kohli makes Australia pay for Marsh error in World Cup opener

image.altText: A bald woman sitting in a hospital chair.

items.synopsis: Katrina Reed says her fight with cervical cancer exposes the hidden financial costs for patients and their families in Australia's health system.

title.children: Katrina's cervical cancer diagnosis was heartbreaking, but the cost of the regional mum's care was 'toxic'

image.altText: a police officer wearing a mask during the covid-19 pandemic in sydney stands outside the entrance to mantra hotel

items.synopsis: Revenue NSW is still chasing the $3,000 fee from more than 17,000 people who have not paid their hotel bill, and has issued more than 5, 000 "garnishee orders" to claw back outstanding payments.

title.children: More than 5,000 people have hotel quarantine debt taken from bank account, as NSW premier defends move

image.altText: A young woman smiles into a mirror while a female hygienist looks on

items.synopsis: Despite a clear link between general and oral health, the dental and medical professions tend to work in isolation. Experts believe it's adding to the chronic disease burden.

title.children: Missed your last trip to the dentist? This is why it could have big implications for your wellbeing

image.altText: A woman leans her arm on a tree stump in front of a painting of the Aboriginal flag.

items.synopsis: Australia's most decentralised mainland state is expected to deliver a resounding No at the Voice to Parliament referendum. We spoke to voters about what's influencing their decision.

title.children: We asked regional Queenslanders how they'll vote in the Voice to Parliament referendum

image.altText: new south wales police officers outside a house in riverwood where the body if a man was found in a truck and a woman in house

items.synopsis: NSW Police attended the property in Riverwood just before 2pm on Sunday and are investigating if the incident is domestic-violence related.

title.children: Dead woman found inside house in Sydney's south, after dead man found in truck parked in driveway

image.altText: Smoke and flames billow after Israeli forces struck a high-rise tower in Gaza.

items.synopsis: Israeli officials in the US say the death toll from the attack by Hamas is now more than 600, with over 1,800 injured, while 100 civilians and soldiers have been kidnapped.

title.children: Israeli death toll rises to more than 600 after Hamas attack — as it happened

image.altText: The remains of a small plane crashed into a charred paddock

items.synopsis: A man has died while a pilot suffered serious injuries when a light aircraft crashed in South Australia's mid-north.

title.children: Man dead, another in critical condition in light plane crash in regional SA

subjects.title: Air and Space Accidents and Incidents

image.altText: Two police vans out the tree-lined entrance to a park.

items.synopsis: Emergency services have closed all entrances to the popular spot, located north of the Darwin CBD, with Parks and Wildlife saying it would stay shut "until further notice".

title.children: Woman killed, man seriously injured after tree branch falls at Darwin Botanic Gardens

image.altText: A man standing among the wrecks after an earthquake.

items.synopsis: A magnitude-6.3 earthquake followed by strong aftershocks kills more than 2,000 people in Afghanistan's west, according to a Taliban spokesman, after hundreds of civilians were buried under rubble.

title.children: Powerful earthquake and aftershocks kill more than 2,000 people in western Afghanistan

image.altText: Richie Stanaway and Shane van Gisbergen celebrate

items.synopsis: Shane van Gisbergen teams up with fellow New Zealander Richie Stanaway to defend his crown with another victory at Mount Panorama.

title.children: 'The perfect way to say goodbye': Van Gisbergen wins third Bathurst 1000 in Supercars farewell

image.altText: A Collingwood AFL player handballs during a match in the 2023 season.

items.synopsis: Collingwood's Taylor Adams makes his trade request official in a move that may see him link up with former teammate Brodie Grundy at Sydney.

title.children: Collingwood star requests AFL trade to Sydney Swans

image.altText: A man wearing a broad-brimmed hat stands on a porch with one arm reaching up.

items.synopsis: When Yindjibarndi leader Michael Woodley stood his ground against Andrew Forrest's FMG he had no idea he'd still be fighting for compensation 14 years later. Despite community division and lengthy court battles he's never backed down.

title.children: 'Money, power and influence': One man's fight against Australia's richest man Andrew Forrest

image.altText: A person with an outbreak of shingles

items.synopsis: The risk of developing shingles increases with age. From next month a new vaccine against the virus, tipped to be 90 per cent effective, will be available through the National Immunisation Program for older and immunocompromised Australians.

title.children: Federal government makes new shingles vaccine free for older Australians from November 1

image.altText: Artist's impression of an asteroid collision with Earth.

items.synopsis: In 2020, Oxford philosopher Toby Ord put the chances of "existential catastrophe" for our species during the next century at one in six. But does it really stack up, asks Steven Stern.

title.children: Is there really a 1 in 6 chance of human extinction this century?

items.synopsis: Australian law enforcement has started solving missing persons and unidentified remains cases using official police access to private genealogy databases, which combined, hold the DNA records of millions of people around the world.

title.children: It's being called the biggest game changer in forensic investigations since DNA testing

image.altText: Jake Fraser-McGurk celebrates his record-breaking century for South Australia.

items.synopsis: Jake Fraser-McGurk only needed 29 balls to reach his century for South Australia, breaking the previous mark set by South African great AB de Villiers in an ODI.

title.children: Fraser-McGurk breaks world record in domestic one-day cup match

image.altText: Vertical gardens and a fountain.

items.synopsis: Singapore will soon join Dubai to provide travellers with a more efficient immigration clearance as early as 2024 following an update to its Immigration Bill.

title.children: Singapore goes passport-free as experts raise alarms on risks. But it's not the first country to do it

image.altText: An elderly woman in a red headscarf stands in front of a wall of family photos

items.synopsis: Aunty Ruth Hegarty lived through a cruel chapter in Australian history. Now aged 94, she's approaching the Voice vote with optimism for future generations.

title.children: 'This is truth-telling': At 94, Ruth Hegarty wants you to hear her story before you vote

image.altText: Anthony Albanese standing in front of "VOTE YES" branding as he announces the date of the Voice to Parliament referendum

items.synopsis: Anthony Albanese says the government will "respect the outcome of the referendum" if the Voice vote fails next weekend.

title.children: PM rules out legislating Voice if referendum fails
